channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 2025 saw Trump set off a race to redraw voting maps
item.description: In 2025, President Trump pushed Republican-led states to find advantages in 2026's elections by redrawing congressional maps. The outcome may determine which party controls the House after midterms.
item.content:encoded: In 2025, President Trump pushed Republican-led states to find advantages in 2026's elections by redrawing congressional maps. The outcome may determine which party controls the House after midterms.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Schneider

item.title: Vince Zampella, co-creator of the 'Call of Duty' video game franchise, dies at 55
item.description: Vince Zampella, co-creator of the hit Call of Duty video games, has died in a Los Angeles car crash.
item.content:encoded: Vince Zampella, co-creator of the hit Call of Duty video games, has died in a Los Angeles car crash.
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: In Israel, some Jews and Christians seek to build trust between their communities
item.description: Despite tensions between the Vatican and Israel's government over the Gaza war, some Jews and Christians living in Israel are trying to build trust between their communities.
item.content:encoded: Despite tensions between the Vatican and Israel's government over the Gaza war, some Jews and Christians living in Israel are trying to build trust between their communities.
item.dc:creator: Jerome Socolovsky

item.title: The Trump administration is recalling about 30 career diplomats
item.description: The Trump administration is recalling dozens of career Ambassadors, saying the president wants diplomats who will advance his agenda. That's what foreign service officers sign up for.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is recalling dozens of career Ambassadors, saying the president wants diplomats who will advance his agenda. That's what foreign service officers sign up for.
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: Why some U.S. oil companies aren't interested in returning to Venezuela
item.description: The Trump administration says it wants U.S. oil companies to return to Venezuela, but some don't desire to re-invest. Why would oil companies be against returning to a country with large oil reserves?
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration says it wants U.S. oil companies to return to Venezuela, but some don't desire to re-invest. Why would oil companies be against returning to a country with large oil reserves?
item.dc:creator: Kai McNamee

item.title: Election betting on prediction markets apps is set to boom ahead of midterms
item.description: Prediction market apps are growing in popularity, allowing people to bet on everything. Critics fear that turning every scenario into a wager could lead to people and institutions being manipulated.
item.content:encoded: Prediction market apps are growing in popularity, allowing people to bet on everything. Critics fear that turning every scenario into a wager could lead to people and institutions being manipulated.
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: A rising country music singer speaks out about his family member arrested by ICE
item.description: When a family member of a popular country music singer was arrested by ICE, he spoke out publicly about the emotional toll of family separation because of immigration bureaucracy.
item.content:encoded: When a family member of a popular country music singer was arrested by ICE, he spoke out publicly about the emotional toll of family separation because of immigration bureaucracy.
item.dc:creator: Rose Gilbert

item.title: Will the U.S. copy Denmark's vaccine schedule?
item.description: The Trump administration has stated it wants the U.S. childhood vaccination schedule to look more like peer nations such as Denmark. Critics say the U.S. has different health threats.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration has stated it wants the U.S. childhood vaccination schedule to look more like peer nations such as Denmark. Critics say the U.S. has different health threats.
item.dc:creator: Maria Godoy

item.title: Supreme Court rules against Trump in National Guard case
item.description: The U.S. Supreme Court ruled against President Trump on Tuesday, refusing to reinstate, for now, Trump's ability to send National Guard troops into the state of Illinois over the objections of the governor.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. Supreme Court ruled against President Trump on Tuesday, refusing to reinstate, for now, Trump's ability to send National Guard troops into the state of Illinois over the objections of the governor.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: How 'aesthetic' became an adjective
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Shane O'Neill of The Washington Post about the word "aesthetic" and its evolution from art criticism and design theory to online speak and the White House.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Shane O'Neill of The Washington Post about the word "aesthetic" and its evolution from art criticism and design theory to online speak and the White House.
item.dc:creator: Linah Mohammad
